Author: Daniel the Hispanophile

Originally from Milwaukee, Wisconsin (USA), Daniel the Hispanophile is a professor of Spanish language and literature in Illinois. He holds a PhD in Hispanic Languages and Literatures from University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) and a Masters of Arts in Teaching degree from Marquette University. His main research interests are 18th and 19th century Spanish peninsular literature.
